Deficiency Narrative: Data was not reported within 15 days of the end of the 2nd quarter.
Correction Narrative:
The operation submitted 2nd Quarter EBI reports. The operation plans to complete the following actions to maintain compliance: 

Calendar Alerts- The operation created calendar reminders 2 weeks prior to the end of the quarter to ensure EBI is completed on time during each quarter.

Monthly Progress Checks: The operation instituted monthly internal reviews to monitor progress and address any potential delays well before the quarterly deadline.

Deficiency Narrative: Rules for pool area were not present.
2 children were presribed new psychotrophic medications without medical consent. Documentation does not support consent was provided for new psychotrophic medications.
1 of 4 fire extinguishers was not serviced in 2025.
Correction Narrative: RCCR received photo documentation of the cited fire extinguisher with a new fire inspection tag dated August 2025.

Deficiency Narrative: Two fence doors were observed to be broken.
Severe weather drills were not completed in 2025.

Two child files were reviewed. Questions posed to make a determination for suicidality was not available in the child's files. The suicide assessment documents results as "not present." The operation submitted policies that indicate a rating of High to Low risk.
The operation stated their policy is to release individual documents via email. The operation did not provide  access to the EMR for the inspection.
Fire inspection was completed 13 months after the previous inspection.
Correction Narrative: The following response was provided by the operation:  We(the operation) have coordinated with a staff member from Inspection Operations at the City of Plano to ensure that the annual fire inspection is scheduled in advance for the upcoming year, immediately following the completion of the current years inspection. This proactive approach is intended to maintain compliance and prevent future delays.

Deficiency Narrative: Four Employees were missing their annual training for Normalcy.
Correction Narrative: The staff has completed their delinquent training. The agency has changed their internal training records to ensure all staff are completing their training in accordance with the standards.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation failed to report a serious incident timely.
The operation administration placed children at risk when they fail to increase staff when additional supervision was needed.
Correction Narrative: Email from operation administrative staff with training documentation. The staff have been retrained.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children in care files did not have a dental exam.
Correction Narrative: The administrator stated in the future the operation will have children in care completed dental examination within 30 days of admission.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple children indicated that they do not have any hot water in the shower.  in addition, there was no hot water in the sinks.
Correction Narrative: An inspection was conduct and all showers and sink were tested. Children in care were interviewed and confirm they have hot water to shower with.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were not dispensed prescribed medication according to instructions.
Correction Narrative: All operation staff took additional medication administration training. Since staff shift may varies all employees have been training to administer medication to children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: The agency did not report to Licensing when staff contracted a communicable disease.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a plan where they will report communicable disease within 24 hours of awareness.

Deficiency Narrative: Several children that were interview stated that they are yelled at by staff.
Correction Narrative:
Children in care were interviewed and stated staff does not yell at them. 

3-4-22- The operation provided a plan where staff will take additional training each year to address communicating compassionately and sensitive.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children in care preliminary service plans did not address any supervision needs.
Correction Narrative: The operation added an additional section to the preliminary service plan that addressed the supervision needs of children in care.

Deficiency Narrative: The facility does not currently have a full time licensed administrator.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency which stated Nicholas Ciancioso has taken and passed his Administrator's License Exam and is now the licensed Administrator for the operation. The email also contained a copy of the exam results and job qualifications for Mr. Ciancioso.

Deficiency Narrative: Both child files reviewed did not have a preliminary service plan completed,
Correction Narrative:
An email was received with the stating the following information:
We have created a separate form that will be used for each client to meet this standard. Our team will complete the preliminary service plan form immediately for current clients and within 72-hours of admission for new clients. We will then scan and upload the form into each clients chart for easy access. I have attached a copy of the preliminary service plan for your records.

Deficiency Narrative: One employee file reviewed did not have a current normalcy training.
Correction Narrative:
Email received from the operation stating the following:
Our plan moving forward is to set calendar reminders to review all active staff trainings at the local level to ensure each staff member is notified of their upcoming training requirements ahead of time and to ensure continued compliance with minimum standards. These trainings will be kept in a shared folder for our Program Director and LCCA to access. I have attached a copy of the employee's normalcy certificate for your records.
